page.title: 08The beach at Llanddulas
page.content: Llanddulas beach is about a quarter of a mile from the village.It is very pebbly,and there is only sand when the tide is right out.There are groynes here and there to control the waves. Also,many huge boulders were brought here by lorries,to make a strong sea wall. The River Dulas flows out here, turning East as it reaches the beach. Part of its course here is an S.S.S.I. because of rare plants and butterflies. There are holiday chalets above the beach,on a small cliff,but the beach is more popular for picnics than bathing,probably because it is so rocky. There used to be a life-boat station here,but it closed in 1932.The boat-house was converted into a private house,right on the beach.
